titleStmt.title: L. Blinns et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9166

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned jurors, who were emapanelled and rendered a verdict in the case of the Commonwealth of Kentucky vs John Mullins, at the March term for 1862 of the Kenton Circuit at Covington, unite in a petition to his Excellency Govr Magoffin that said Mullins be repreived; believing as we do, after hearing the evidence in his case, and being familiar with the circumstances attending it, that Mr Mullins is a proper subject for Executive clemency.

L. Blinns
Jno W. Coleman Jr.
Abner Pierce
James Riggs
H, H, Karre
John Hasenurer
James T Eubank --
William Montague
Enoch Anderson
James Downey
James A, Barns
John, B, Pugh
State of Kentucky Kenton County & Circuit St --
The above named persons are the persons who where Enpannelled & sworn & tried the cause of the Commonwealth of Kentucky agst John Mullins, witness my hand as clerk of said court August 4th 1862
